importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The article does not specify a release date for the series. The only date provided is the publication date (October 20, 2025), which is not a relevant date in the context of the show's timeline or launch.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The series begins in the 1930s and spans up to 1956, covering the formative years of the Kennedy family, including the early lives of Joe and Rose Kennedy and their children, especially Jack Kennedy, before his rise to the presidency.

keyTakeAways: A new Netflix drama titled 'Kennedy' is being developed, based on Fredrik Logevall’s biography 'JFK: Coming of Age in the American Century, 1917–1956'.
The series stars Michael Fassbender as Joe Kennedy, Sr., and explores the triumphs and tragedies of the Kennedy family across multiple generations.
The show begins in the 1930s and traces the rise of Joe and Rose Kennedy and their children, including Jack Kennedy, who struggles to escape the shadow of his older brother, Robert F. Kennedy.

The narrative aims to humanize the Kennedy dynasty, revealing personal struggles behind the public myth, with showrunner Sam Shaw describing it as 'somewhere between Shakespeare and The Bold and the Beautiful'.
The series is distinct from Ryan Murphy’s upcoming 'American Love Story,' which focuses on JFK Jr. and is not a continuation or related to this series.
The series will consist of eight episodes and has not yet been released, though it is set to launch on Netflix.

namedEntities.name: Kennedy family
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A prominent American political dynasty that includes John F. Kennedy, Robert F. Kennedy, and other notable figures.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Kennedy family is the central subject of the new Netflix series, serving as the narrative backbone through which the story of American political dynasty and myth is explored.

namedEntities.name: Michael Fassbender
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A British actor known for his roles in films such as 'The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo' and 'The Theory of Everything'.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Fassbender is starring as Joe Kennedy, Sr., the patriarch of the Kennedy family, giving the series a high-profile casting that draws attention from audiences and critics alike.

namedEntities.name: Fredrik Logevall
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: An American historian and author, known for his biography 'JFK: Coming of Age in the American Century, 1917–1956'.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The series is based on his biography, which provides historical and personal insight into the Kennedy family's formative years, lending scholarly depth and authenticity to the narrative.

namedEntities.name: Sam Shaw
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: The showrunner of the new 'Kennedy' series.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Shaw is responsible for developing the series’ narrative direction, emphasizing the human aspects behind the Kennedy myth, and has stated that the show offers insight into how America evolved politically and culturally.

namedEntities.name: Netflix
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A global streaming platform offering original content across various genres.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Netflix is the production and distribution platform for the new series, indicating its appeal to a broad international audience and signaling a major cultural moment in political storytelling on streaming media.

namedEntities.name: John F. Kennedy
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: The 35th President of the United States, son of Joe Kennedy, Sr., and a central figure in American political history.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He is a key character in the series, representing both the rise of the Kennedy dynasty and the tragic elements that have shaped public perception of the family.

namedEntities.name: Robert F. Kennedy
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: The brother of John F. Kennedy, a U.S. Senator and presidential hopeful who was assassinated.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: His presence in the narrative highlights the tragedies within the family, contributing to the theme of the 'Kennedy curse' and the family’s tragic legacy.

namedEntities.name: JFK Jr.
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: The son of John F. Kennedy, who died in a plane crash in 1999 with his wife and sister-in-law.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: His death is cited as part of the broader narrative of tragedy within the Kennedy family, reinforcing the cultural mythos and emotional weight of the story.

namedEntities.name: Ryan Murphy
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A television producer known for producing 'American Love Story,' a series about JFK Jr.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Ryan Murphy’s upcoming series is contrasted with the new 'Kennedy' series, emphasizing that the new show is a separate, broader exploration of the Kennedy family's history, not focused on JFK Jr. specifically.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Netflix is launching a new drama series titled 'Kennedy,' based on Fredrik Logevall’s biography, which explores the rise and tragedies of the Kennedy family from the 1930s to 1956. The series stars Michael Fassbender as Joe Kennedy, Sr., and delves into the personal and political struggles of the family, including Jack Kennedy’s journey to escape the shadow of his older brother, Robert F. Kennedy. Showrunner Sam Shaw emphasizes the human side of the Kennedy myth, likening it to American literature and soap operas. The show is distinct from Ryan Murphy’s upcoming 'American Love Story,' which focuses on JFK Jr., and will consist of eight episodes with no official release date yet.
title: Netflix Announces New Kennedy Family Series Starring Michael Fassbender
